stories.text:
I'm pretty good at Rust, and Go is pretty easy - both compile to wasm or desktop native and have web/dekstop UI toolkits that have tiny memory footprints see:

1. https://www.egui.rs/ 2. https://gioui.org/

I find using slack, discord, and zoom unpleasant.

I've been toying with writing a zoom and slack replacement native for all platforms in either Rust or Go.

Should I do it?

I don't want to build it - and be the only one to use it - so I'm hoping I can get enough inspiring comments to go for it.
stories.title: No Electron Alternatives

stories.text:
There's an organization that assists soldiers returning to civilian life that has a Facebook page. They list their website address on their FB page but FB blocks taking users through to the website. FB claims the site violates community standards. The organization is aware of the issue and says they have tried contacting FB to get clarification on the issue and try to remedy it several times over the past few years. They have never gotten a response.

We can argue and rage about "how awful" the US military is, but that doesn't seem productive. Healing and restoring soldiers mental health that have gone through some of the questionable and traumatic experiences they've had seems like a worthy and noble cause.

I'm honestly asking for anyone's insight into what standard is being violated (it seems to me that some AI has flagged the site incorrectly in regards to suicide) and or how one can get better answers from FB.

Sincerely and thank you.

P.S. The website is https://operationrestoredwarrior.org/
stories.title: Ask HN: Can anyone help me understand why Facebook is blocking this website?
Apple Testing iPhones That Ditch Lightning Ports in Favor of USB-C
